metadata.subject: Rockefeller Financial Services documents and articles compilation

organizations: Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP
financial_entities: Morgan Stanley Wealth and Asset Management

relationships.description: Viking Global Investors is backing Rockefeller Capital Management through an investment by one of its investment funds
Fleming becomes CEO of Rockefeller Capital Management
Rockefeller family trust remains an owner of the firm, though selling some stake as part of the transaction
Lord Jacob Rothschild's RIT Capital Partners purchased Société Générale's stake in Rockefeller & Co.

transactions: Viking Global investment in Rockefeller Capital Management
Sale of Société Générale's stake to RIT Capital Partners
Miami Marlins baseball team purchase deal
assets: Rockefeller Financial Services assets under advisement: $35B

analysis.purpose: To document business transactions, provide investment analysis, and promote Rockefeller Financial Services' capabilities
analysis.significance: Shows the transformation of Rockefeller's family office into a modern financial services firm and provides investment insights during a period of market stability

concerns: Corporate governance issues in South Korea

notable_quotes: "The industry is very fragmented. For independent companies that combine wealth and asset management, as well as advisory, there's room, if you do it well, to really generate some market share, especially for a firm with a brand as good as Rockefeller." - Greg Fleming

"Despite the turbulence of the period when I stepped in, it was a remarkably strong franchise and business. It was a real testament to what had been created by generations long before me." - Reuben Jeffery III
"One should be fearful when others are greedy and greedy when others are fearful." - Jimmy Chang referencing Warren Buffett
red_flags: Corporate governance concerns in emerging markets

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in the documents

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed or evidenced in these documents

details: Bloomberg article by Jennifer Surane and Simone Foxman
Barron's article by Richard C. Morais
Various media coverage of financial markets and corporate developments

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a collection of publicly available documents including press releases, website content, and published articles about Rockefeller Financial Services and related financial market analysis

analysis.summary: This document compilation covers the formation of Rockefeller Capital Management through a partnership between Rockefeller Financial Services and Gregory J. Fleming, backed by Viking Global Investors, along with investment analysis pieces discussing market conditions, corporate governance, and global economic trends from Rockefeller's perspective.
